messages.message:
Hey everyone (especially those who speak multiple languages). We've built a preview of an experimental document translation app and need your help to test it out. You can try it out in the internal sandbox - https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/hub/apps/4b55066c-d99a-4784-a2ee-6db5d3c88ed4. Two known issues to keep in mind:
1. The app doesn't work if you're not logged in. Please signin with google using your @ instabase.com (http://instabase.com) account
2. The app only displays the first page of the source document for now. Please reference your original document separately until this is fixed.
Early feedback from all of you will be really useful. Please let us know if you run into any issues or if you have any suggestions about its quality. Thanks!
@avi - I tried a handwritten german doc linked below. Output is worse than just asking for translation in standard AI hub on advanced.
Let me know if you can't access that^

@Ben Wood, thanks for trying it out. Unfortunately I can't access the link. This is likely because we're using a different translation engine v/s plain GPT and useful feedback about the quality.

@jayasooryan do you have admin access to aihub-sandbox? Can you access the link?

I'm able to access the doc with admin access!

Current doc translation app doesn't work really well with rotated/skewed docs. That's the primary reason why the output doesn't look good in this case. We will address this in future versions. :slightly_smiling_face:

I tried translating our Ameritas Dental Plan Summary to Chinese. Overall, the translation looks good, except for a few things :slightly_smiling_face: :
1. The last page is left untranslated  
2. Some tables are not outputted as tables
3. Some translations are awkward, just like Google translate :sweat_smile:

Thanks for the feedback @Xindi Xu!!
1. This is actually related to the Reader behaviour. The last page of the document seems to be an image where as rest of the document is machine-readable. So reader doesn't capture any text for the last page, and there is no translation. We can turn on the force image OCR for handling these cases, but then we lose styling information (bold, italics, etc.) which is readily available in machine readable documents. We will also be doing OCR for all pages of machine-readable PDFs! Let me check with the team if there is any other way to handle this.
2. We do segmentation of text and apply translations to those segments. Generally I have seen good detection and segmentation for tables. But in this case, it's not detecting that segment as a table which is why the structure is not preserved. You can see that it captures the table right below it correctly. I think it is because there is lesser structure (no borders, no color separation between rows, not much spacing between rows, etc. ) in the table where it failed.
3. We use Microsoft translator for the job! Haha.
